meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your boy, back with a review that's more fun than a Marvel movie marathon. Today, we're talkin' LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2, and let me tell you, it's a doozy!

Now, I know what you're thinkin', "Another LEGO game? Yawn." But hold up, partner, 'cause this one's got some serious Marvel muscle behind it. First off, the game's all about variety – we're talkin' settings, heroes, and abilities galore! You'll get to play as your favorite Marvel characters, from Iron Man to Thor, and even some new ones you might not know (I'm lookin' at you, Carnom!). And let me tell you, the co-op mode is where it's at – grab a friend, pick your heroes, and get ready for some serious butt-kickin' fun!

Now, I know our friends over at IGN are gonna give this game an 80, and hey, they're not wrong. It's a lotta fun, especially if you're a Marvel nut or just looking for some light-hearted gaming goodness. But don't worry, non-Marvel fans – the story's lighthearted enough to make up for any mild annoyances (read: combat that's still pretty simple).

GameSpot gave it a 70, and I gotta agree with them on this one – while the game might not be reinventing the wheel, it's still a solid addition to the LEGO franchise. And hey, if you're a completionist or just looking for some fun times with friends, this game's got your back.

Now, let's get to the scores. Gaming Age gave it an 83 – and I think they might be biased, but in a good way! They're all about them LEGO games (I'm right there with 'em). And hey, Vandal's 77 ain't too shabby either – they know what they liked (more on that later).

So, what's the verdict? Well, for me, it's all about the fun factor. Is this game a winner? Absolutely! Will you have some serious fun with friends and family? Heck yeah! Just don't expect anything new or groundbreaking (that's not exactly what we're here for, am I right?).

So, there you have it – LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2: a solid addition to the franchise that's all about variety, co-op, and good ol' fashioned fun. Now if you'll excuse me, I've gotta go play some more (and maybe write a review or two). Happy gaming, folks!
